questions.question_text: Identify the correct statement from the given list.

discussion.content: A is kind of correct. In self lookup, this is not the case. But apparently the other 3 are all untrue.

choices.D: Lookup fields can be used to delete an object
choices.C: Lookup fields change the record ownership

choices.B: By Setting property in page layout

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B should best answer

For custom-f's , they could be made mandatory during creation as well(Always require a value). Later on, for all fields, there could be valid'n-rules(ISBLANK/ISNULL), Lastly, make'em reqd in Page Layout.

questions.question_text: How can you ensure that a value is entered in a field?
The Data Loader can de-duplicate records during import.

discussion.content: Import Wizard can do this, be careful not to confuse the two.

Selected Answer: B
Import Wizard can do this, be careful not to confuse the two.

questions.question_text: Which step is required when configuring the new Salesforce for outlook?

choices.C: Assign users and profiles to a configuration
choices.D: Enable the chatter feed sync with Outlook
choices.A: Select sync direction and conflict behaviour

discussion.content:
Contact Manager Edition is no longer sold.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.overview_other_editions.htm&type=5

choices.A: Since there is no Weekly Export in contact manager, you can instead install Salesforce for outlook.
choices.B: You can create a report on those records and use the "Export Details" button.
choices.C: Use Connect for Outlook because Salesforce for Outloook does not run without API.
choices.E: There is no export option in Contact Manager
choices.D: Export those records using weekly data export from "Setup > Administration Setup > Data Management > Export".

questions.question_text: How can you export accounts and contacts in a Contact Manager edition of Salesforce?
